reviews.text: This was one of the nicest Best Western hotels we stayed in on our trip thru Italy. The staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms were great and the beds were comfortable. They did tell us they could give us adjoining rooms but they are separate; however looking on the emergency route map there are no adjoining rooms, so we think they mistook our request as adjacent - my teenage girls think it's great they have their very own room so no biggie for us!! The rooms are a decent size, especially for a European hotel and the bathrooms are marvellous - a huge big tub, a powerful shower and very spacious. Breakfast was very comprehensive, one of the best selections of our trip and my husband loved the bacon which we'd read about in a review posted only a few days ahead of our stay and he was already looking forward to it! Yes the hotel is outside Bologna centre but it only took us 15 minutes to get to the old city so it's not exactly a looong hike and there are a lot of arcades (Bologna is noted for them) so plenty of shade to walk in. Parking is free and they have lots of it, including a covered garage. The wifi is also free, you just have to ask for the code at the desk, and they have a computer in the reception/lounge area for communal use too if you don't bring your own. If I had one comment not 100% positive it would be about the reception furniture, I'm not sure it's really retro but it's definitely alternative; however if all the hotels I went to looked like that at the front desk, yet the rooms and service were as nice as here, I could learn to love that look! I would stay here again in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 3 days in the Best Western Hotel in Bologna. On arrival the staff were friendly and spoke very good English, offering advice on various transport matters and tourist sites. The room was comfortable for the price, clean sheets every day and a very comfortable bath. Breakfast was comprehensive, unusually including hot bacon and eggs. The Hotels free WiFi was excellent.
reviews.title: Comfortable, affordable and friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only possible drawback would be the location, a 15 min alk to the Railway Stn and 30 to the middle of town. There did appear to be a good bus service, but we had good weather and enjoyed the walk each day.
reviews.title: Great value, good location; easy access to old town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall really impressed with our stay - if we visit Bologna again then this is where we will stay - a very comfortable, Hotel with very helpfull staff.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: Bus to town was so simple, it was terrific--close and convenient and frequent, very short trip and easy to catch on the way back (watch out for sudden unannounced strikes though). Breakfast was good, sufficient, lots of fruit, great cappuccinos (eggs from mix not so great). Rooms were lovely size, good clean bathroom, good toiletries. But air conditioner was not located so that it could cool the room down adequately, that was a problem, and it was noisy. All the female front desk staff very efficient and friendly and made great restaurant recommendations and reservations; (there were good places nearby as well as a huge food supermarket); both male front desk staff incompetent and pretended not to notice you at length when you stood there waiting to ask for their help and then weren't much use.
reviews.title: Fine hotel, good breakfast, very nice staff
Bright and clean hotel
reviews.text: Although the hotel was not centrally located, it was a decent place to stay in Bologna. The room was a good size, clean, well decorated and furnished with a nice spacious bathroom.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby is welcoming and the breakfast room is very brightly coloured in a modern style. Breakfast was very good.
reviews.title: Fine Place to stay outside of the center

reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights - Bologna is an amazing city and so beautiful. There are some great restaurants in the city and there is lots to see if you enjoy historical sites and architecture.
reviews.title: Good hotel need to walk or bus to the city centre

reviews.text: The only downside is that the hotel is approx. 30 mins walk away from the centre. It is a nice walk though, especially after a meal and a bottle of wine!
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Good bargain !!!

reviews.text: WARNING - this hotel has a lot of constructiuon work going on at the moment. Expected end date October 2004. But this is Italy, so you never know. They start work around 09:00...
reviews.title: Warning - Men at Work!

reviews.text: Stayed there during the Book Fair. Walkable to the fairgrounds (30 minutes), but more convenient to take Bus #35 which takes you to the fairgrounds. About a 7 minute walk to the bus stop. Walkable to old city as well (20 easy minutes). The best thing about the hotel is that it's in a quiet residental setting. I had my window open every night (the room would not cool down to the temp I like) and I was never awakened by cars/sirens. The reception is very friendly, the breakfast, which is included offered something for everyone. Free internet access in your room (just ask for a passcode) or on their communal computer. Beds were firm but comfortable. Sheets were wonderful. Overall a very pleasant stay.
reviews.title: Quiet, Comfortable, Convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ..don't let its location of "slightly out of town" put you off. Slap-bang adjacent to a bus-stop where a regular No.27 takes you into the city for Euro1. Warm & friendly staff...room was very good. Tea-making facilities on request.. free Internet facilities on request..(both at no extra charge)... nice fullsome Continental breakfast. Very quiet room... No gripes at all... a bed's a bed at the end of the day. ;-)
reviews.title: Warm & Friendly Welcome... & for a chain, not bland...

reviews.text: Bit of a weird, modern style to the building... but the architect probably got the "Best Making the most of the available land" award. Would recommend...and would go again.
reviews.title: The best surprise is no surprise

reviews.text: We have tryed lots of Hotels in our trips and the best surprise was to found a standard in Best Western. As soon as we arrived we found everything we want and everything we need.
reviews.title: very good, absolutely nothing to criticise

reviews.text: Excellent, 10 x better than i expected. Rooms look better than photos on the site. Large, extremely clean. Bathroom also large with all amenities. Every day cleaning and this means also new soaps and shampoos. Free wi fi(not mentioned on the site). Very friendly staff. Breakfast choices diverse and tasty(cheeses, salami, prosciuto, yoghurts, 4 types of croissant and cakes, cereals, fresh fruits and many more). The lady from the restaurant makes capuccino and expresso by request. The hotel doesn`t seem very soundproof, since one night I heard someone snoring, but in January most of the rooms were free, so it didn`t bothered us. The distance to the railway station is ok (10-15 min by foot) and the neighborhood makes no problems(we usually came home at 8.30-9, when already dark and felt no danger around). I advise this place as having an excelent value for money. The hotel is more a 4 than a 3 star.
reviews.title: Very friendly, helpful hotel staff
